verses.verse: Remember your Creator before the silver cord is loosed, Or the golden bowl is broken, Or the pitcher shattered at the fountain, Or the wheel broken at the well.
(Gen. 3:19; Job 34:15; Ps. 90:3) Then the dust will return to the earth as it was, (Eccl. 3:21) And the spirit will return to God (Num. 16:22; 27:16; Job 34:14; Is. 57:16; Zech. 12:1) who gave it.
“Vanity (Ps. 62:9) of vanities,” says the Preacher, “All is vanity.”
The Whole Duty of Man And moreover, because the Preacher was wise, he still taught the people knowledge; yes, he pondered and sought out and (1 Kin. 4:32) set in order many proverbs.
The Preacher sought to find acceptable words; and what was written was upright—words of truth.
The words of the wise are like goads, and the words of scholars are like well-driven nails, given by one Shepherd.
And further, my son, be admonished by these. Of making many books there is no end, and (Eccl. 1:18) much study is wearisome to the flesh.
Let us hear the conclusion of the whole matter: ((Deut. 6:2; 10:12); Mic. 6:8) Fear God and keep His commandments, For this is man’s all.
For (Eccl. 11:9; Matt. 12:36; (Acts 17:30, 31; Rom. 2:16; 1 Cor. 4:5; 2 Cor. 5:10)) God will bring every work into judgment, Including every secret thing, Whether good or evil.
Solomon’s Love for a Shulamite Girl The (1 Kin. 4:32) song of songs, which is Solomon’s.
The BanquetThe Shulamite Let him kiss me with the kisses of his mouth— (Song 4:10) For your love is better than wine.
Because of the fragrance of your good ointments, Your name is ointment poured forth; Therefore the virgins love you.

(Hos. 11:4; John 6:44; 12:32) Draw me away! (Phil. 3:12-14) We will run after you. The king (Ps. 45:14, 15; John 14:2; Eph. 2:6) has brought me into his chambers. We will be glad and rejoice in you. We will remember your love more than wine. Rightly do they love you.
The Daughters of JerusalemThe ShulamiteThe Daughters of JerusalemThe ShulamiteI am dark, but lovely, O daughters of Jerusalem, Like the tents of Kedar, Like the curtains of Solomon.

Do not look upon me, because I am dark, Because the sun has tanned me. My mother’s sons were angry with me; They made me the keeper of the vineyards, But my own (Song 8:11, 12) vineyard I have not kept.
(To Her Beloved)Tell me, O you whom I love, Where you feed your flock, Where you make it rest at noon. For why should I be as one who veils herself By the flocks of your companions?
The BelovedIf you do not know, (Song 5:9) O fairest among women, Follow in the footsteps of the flock, And feed your little goats Beside the shepherds’ tents.
